intro: Agathosma hirtoides, commonly known as Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
